markdownRemark.html:
When it comes to being creative, I‚Äôve always had high hopes and aspirations.

But like the ‚ôìÔ∏èI am, I let myself get lazy and end up with lots of unfinished projects: I‚Äôm looking directly at an unfinished canvas as I type this.

And in the off chance that I have a spurt of inspiration and drive to complete something for myself, I tend to become obsessive over the tiniest of details and spend hours trying to get something just right.

For this blog, I spent a couple hours alone trying to decide on a color palette ‚Äî looking for colors I liked that were also widely accessible. To accomplish this, I used a combination of Color Safe, Color Space, Paletton, and Web Aim Color Contrast Checker. After spending a couple hours on a color palette alone, I was quickly burnt out on all work for this blog so I published and called it quits for the night.

In the morning, I checked the blog to realize I hadn‚Äôt changed the favicon to something of my own.

I have never been great at time-boxing myself, but in that moment I realized that had I not gotten carried away with the color palette I might‚Äôve remembered to update the favicon.

So to kill 2 birds with 1 stone, I decided that I would practice time-boxing myself and my advance Sketch skills by creating a favicon for myself. I knew that I wanted the icon to be a üçç ‚Äî pineapples have been a symbolic part of my life for some years now ‚Äî but I was unsure of how I wanted the icon to look and feel.

frontmatter.title: I made a favicon using Sketch
